title.native: 盾の勇者の成り上がり Season 2
title.romaji: Tate no Yuusha no Nariagari Season 2
title.english: The Rising of the Shield Hero Season 2

description:
The second season of Tate no Yuusha no Nariagari.

With another Wave happening in a week, Naofumi Iwatani and his party have no time to waste. However, when bat familiars raid Lurolona Village and the Wave countdown comes to a halt, the Four Cardinal Heroes reconvene with the queen, Mirelia Q Melromarc, for a quick briefing. The queen presumes that the odd occurrences are linked to the Spirit Tortoise—a threatening creature that has awakened from its slumber, back to cause havoc once again. A plan to put the Spirit Tortoise to rest is devised—but out of the four men, only the cursed Shield Hero agrees to help.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)
synonyms: ผู้กล้าโล่ผงาด ภาค 2

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Slavery
tags.description: Prominently features slaves, slavery, or slave trade.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Kingdom Management
tags.description: Characters in these series take on the responsibility of running a town or kingdom, whether they take control of an existing one, or build their own from the ground up.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Fishing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of fishing.

node.description: [Syosetu](https://mypage.syosetu.com/172188/) | [Syosetu (+18 Version)](https://xmypage.syosetu.com/x5078q/) After growing interested in reading and gaming, Aneko began to write novels. Aneko wrote Tate no Yuusha no Nariagari and began posting it online. After updating the story daily, an unprecedented amount of readers became addicted to the rapid pace of the advancing story, and the novel became an online hit. It was first collected and published by Media Factory in Japan in August of 2013. Aneko Yusagi was recently quoted saying, “I will rise and find great success in life.” (Source: One Peace Books)

__Origin:__ Perth, Australia
__Alma Mater:__ Royal College of Music (2015)

[Website](https://www.kpenkmusic.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kevinpenkin) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kevinpenkincomposer) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kpenkin) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCD05wgzXUYvA7rIE3XGfFFg) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/kevinpenkin) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kevin_Penkin)

An Australian anime composer and video game composer. He is best known for composing the award-winning score to the anime [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/).

Penkin grew up in Perth, Australia. His interest in game music came from listening to the "Phendrana Drifts" theme from Metroid Prime; in a 2012 interview, he referred to the theme's electronic synths and acoustic instruments as "absolute bliss." Penkin began his career with composition credits in the 2011 short films Play Lunch and The Adventures of Chipman and Biscuit Boy. In the same year, Penkin composed the soundtrack of the video game Jūzaengi: Engetsu Sangokuden; this soundtrack represented Penkin's first collaboration with [Nobuo Uematsu](https://anilist.co/staff/100150). Penkin has continued to collaborate with Uematsu in titles such as Norn9 and Defender’s Quest II: Mists of Ruin.

In 2015, Penkin graduated from the Royal College of Music with a Master's degree in Composition for Screen. In 2016, Penkin collaborated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/) on the [Norn9](https://anilist.co/anime/20643/) anime and the [Under the Dog](https://anilist.co/anime/21002/) original video animation soundtracks. Penkin's relationship with Kinema Citrus continued through to 2017 for the soundtrack of [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/), winning the 2017 Crunchyroll Anime Award for Best Score with it. In 2018, Penkin composed the score for the video game Florence. Penkin composed the music for Kinema Citrus' adaptation of [The Rising of the Shield Hero](https://anilist.co/anime/99263/) and NetEase's VR game Nostos in 2019. Penkin most recently composed the music for the 2020 anime adaptation of the South Korean webtoon [Tower of God](https://anilist.co/anime/115230/), winning the 2021 Crunchyroll Anime Award for Best Score with it.

He used to live in the United Kingdom, but currently resides in Melbourne, Australia.

__[Website](https://fujikawachiai.com/profile/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Nippon Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/artist-info/fujikawachiai/prof.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fujikawachiai)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/fujikawa_chiai/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPn4XA6Gb2u8y_FXXtrHW7w)__

__Height:__ 162 cm
__Graduated:__ Okayama Prefectural Kasaoka Commercial High School

__Introduction:__
Chiai Fujikawa is a Japanese vocalist and lyricist under record label Nippon Columbia (2018-). Before going solo she was a lead singer in the idol group Maneki Kecak, between July of 2015 until her departure from the group in September of 2018. She has additionally performed at the Nippon Budokan, which took place on September 24 of 2018.

Activities as a solo artist began after debuting at "TOKYO CULTURE CULTURE", where she held an Acoustic Live event on November 25 of 2018, this was followed-up with her first album release on May of 2019, titled "Raika".

__Biography:__
After graduating high school, Chiai aimed to become a singer while working at a factory. She mentions how she wanted to write her own lyrics whenever she became an artist, so she had been writing poems in her notebooks since she was a student. Whenever she came up with a word, sentence, or anything that could be used in a song, she would write it in a notepad she kept on her phone.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MADKID_official)

MADKID (マッドキッド), formerly known as J-BOYS-5, is a Japanese vocal and dance boy group formed on July 20, 2014. Currently, they consist of 3 vocals and 2 rappers.
In 2018 they made their major-label debut under Nippon Columbia.

Current Members:
* [YOU-TA (ゆーた)](https://anilist.co/staff/270066/YOUTA) (Leader; joined September 2014)
* KAZUKI (かずき)
* SHIN (しん) (Joined February 1, 2017)
* [LIN (りん)](https://anilist.co/staff/270067/LIN)
* [YUKI (ゆき)](https://anilist.co/staff/270070/YUKI)

Former Members:
* KENTO (Leader; left September 2014; now member of IVVY as KENTO.i)
* RIKITO (Left May 2015)
* CASEY (Joined in summer 2015, left January 2016)
